intro: Siphocampylus longior, commonly known as the long-stemmed siphocampylus, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate environments, often found in meadows and woodland edges. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a mild, aromatic scent. Siphocampylus longior is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting local pollinator populations.
